alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hancock; Henry; Rush; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 12:13AM EDT until April 01 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SHELBY...EAST CENTRAL HANCOCK...RUSH...NORTHERN DECATUR AND HENRY COUNTIES... At 1213 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Winchester to 6 miles northwest of Rushville to 7 miles west of Greensburg, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... New Castle, Greensburg, Rushville, Adams, Knightstown, Geneva, St. Paul, Carthage, Spiceland, Shirley, Kennard, Sulphur Springs, Mooreland, Lewisville, Mount Summit, Milroy, Glenwood, Straughn, Dunreith and Cadiz. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 113 and 133. Interstate 74 between mile markers 120 and 135. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central and east central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
